Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> Do we have to have some komodo default to transfer other assets. I want to transfer CHIPS  to the agama wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> Are you using Lite mode?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> As Acura said, you just need to activate Chips coin in Lite mode, it's the same address as KMD.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> I don't understand what lite mode is. I have never used a komodo wallet before. Can you clarify.  Thanks (re @yorklab: Are you using Lite mode?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> How do you currently store Chips?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> download the Agama wallet, you may understand more by using it first. Follow the guides with the link I supplied above.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> It's on exchange. (re @yorklab: How do you currently store Chips?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> So to transfer chips, I have to activate chips in LITE mode. (re @yorklab: As Acura said, you just need to activate Chips coin in Lite mode, it's the same address as KMD.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> Download wallet, follow guides. Create new KMD address. That same address is also used for Chips. Be sure to use "Lite" mode. Native downloads the entire blockchain.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> Okay. Thanks. So Chips is an asset chain on the Komodo blockchain. (re @yorklab: Download wallet, follow guides. Create new KMD address. That same address is also used for Chips. Be sure to use "Lite" mode. Native downloads the entire blockchain.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> Thanks for the helpüòäüëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> The first time you create the new wallet address, be sure to copy the address and your new key. Log out, then log back in and make sure it's the same address. If you mistype the key it will be a different address. Do this before any transfers.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> In fact do this a couple of times to be sure you have the correct address before transferring.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Kpprabhu> Okay. Thanks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> No. That's just not how hardware wallets work. Hardware requires you to interact with it to use the private keys. Claiming rewards requires you sending your balance to yourself, which you can only do with the keys. Got to use the hardware once a month (after this is implemented) (re @Andreeees: If kmd is on ledger, will the rewards be claimed automatically?
So can i store them for years and get continuously rewardd on same wallet adress?)
